Package chord

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • chord.Node
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Node>
    public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Node>
    This class defines the behavior of the agents in the simulation

    • Constructor Detail

      • Node

        public Node​(TopologyBuilder top,
            repast.simphony.space.graph.Network<java.lang.Object> viewNet,
            java.util.Random rnd,
            int hash_size,
            int id,
            double x,
            double y,
            double crash_pr,
            double crash_scheduling_interval,
            double recovery_interval,
            int successors_size,
            double stab_offset,
            int stab_amplitude,
            java.util.ArrayList<Lookup> lookup_table)
        Public constructor
        Parameters:
        top - reference to the TopologyBuilder
        viewNet - network
        rnd - random number generator
        hash_size - number of bits of the hash used for identifiers
        id - node id
        x - x coordinate in the continuous space
        y - y coordinate in the continuous space
        crash_pr - probability of node crash
        crash_scheduling_interval - interval for probabilistic crash scheduling
        recovery_interval - number of ticks needed for recovery
        successors_size - size of the successors list
        stab_offset - minimum offset between stabilizations
        stab_amplitude - maximum interval to be added to the offset
        lookup_table - reference to the list of Lookups instances

        Creates a new Chord ring

        Parameters:

      • find_successor

        public void find_successor​(int id,
                           java.lang.String target_dt,
                           int position)
        Looks for the node responsible for the given identifier
        Parameters:
        id - id of interest
        target_dt - target data structure: "init", "finger", "successors" or "lookup"
        position - index in the target data structure

      • find_successor_step

        public void find_successor_step​(Node target_node,
                                java.util.ArrayList<Node> prev_contacted_nodes,
                                int id,
                                java.lang.String target_dt,
                                int position,
                                int path_length,
                                int num_timeouts,
                                int nodes_contacted)
        Performs an iterative step of find_successor
        Parameters:
        target_node - node to ask for the given id
        prev_contacted_nodes - list of previously contacted nodes
        id - id of interest
        target_dt - target data structure: "init", "finger", "successors" or "lookup"
        position - index in the target data structure
        path_length - length of the query path
        num_timeouts - number of timeouts experienced
        nodes_contacted - number of nodes contacted

      • processSuccRequest

        public repast.simphony.util.collections.Pair<Node,​java.lang.Boolean> processSuccRequest​(int id)
        Processes a successor request
        Parameters:
        id - id of interest
        Returns:
        pair (Node, Boolean): the first element is null if the current node is not subscribed or crashed; the second one defines if the retrieved node is the one responsible for the given id

      • getPrevSuccessor

        public Node getPrevSuccessor​(Node dead,
                             int id)
        Removes references to a node no longer present from finger and successor, returning the next closest preceding node w.r.t. the given id (if the current node is subscribed and not crashed).
        Parameters:
        dead - reference to the dead node
        id - id of interest
        Returns:
        the reference to the next closest preceding node, null if the current node is unsubscribed or crashed

      • processSuccResponse

        public void processSuccResponse​(repast.simphony.util.collections.Pair<Node,​java.lang.Boolean> response,
                                Node source,
                                java.util.ArrayList<Node> prev_contacted_nodes,
                                int id,
                                java.lang.String target_dt,
                                int position,
                                int path_length,
                                int num_timeouts,
                                int nodes_contacted)
        Processes response to a successor request
        Parameters:
        response - pair (Node, Boolean) returned by the contacted node
        source - contacted node
        prev_contacted_nodes - list of previously contacted nodes
        id - id of interest
        target_dt - target data structure: "init", "finger", "successors" or "lookup"
        position - index in the target data structure
        path_length - length of the query path
        num_timeouts - number of timeouts experienced
        nodes_contacted - number of nodes contacted

      • schedule_stabilization

        public void schedule_stabilization()
        Schedules the next stabilization step according to the given offset and amplitude

      • stabilization

        public void stabilization​(int retryCount)
        Performs a stabilization round: stabilization_step, fix_data_structures and check_predecessor are called
        Parameters:
        retryCount - : contacting the i-th successor, as the previous ones were inactive
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if all successor have been contacted with no luck

      • stabilization_step

        public void stabilization_step​(Node answeringNode)
        Performs a stabilization step (stabilization of the immediate successor) and schedules processStabResponse
        Parameters:
        answeringNode - the first alive successor

      • getPredecessor

        public Node getPredecessor()
        Returns the predecessor of the current node
        Returns:
        the predecessor of the current node

      • processStabRequest

        public repast.simphony.util.collections.Pair<Node,​java.util.ArrayList<Node>> processStabRequest​(Node pred,
                                                                                                      double set_pred_delay)
        Responds to the stabilization request from another node
        Parameters:
        pred - reference to the predecessor (node requiring stabilization)
        set_pred_delay - delay for predecessor notification
        Returns:
        a pair type containing the node itself and its successors, or (null,null) if not sub or crashed

      • notifiedPredecessor

        public void notifiedPredecessor​(Node predecessor)
        Updates the predecessor of the current node if the new one is closer w.r.t. the old one
        Parameters:
        predecessor - reference to the new predecessor

      • setNewSuccessor

        public void setNewSuccessor​(Node successor)
        Sets the successor of the current node to the new value
        Parameters:
        successor - reference to the new successor

      • processStabResponse

        public void processStabResponse​(repast.simphony.util.collections.Pair<Node,​java.util.ArrayList<Node>> stabResponse)
        Manage the response of a stabilization request, updating the successors list, eventually asking the following successor in case the immediate ones is not available anymore. At the end, it calls fix_data_structures()
        Parameters:
        stabResponse - pair of responding node and its successors list

      • fix_data_structures

        public void fix_data_structures()
        Wrapper for the functions that manage the stabilization of the predecessor, the entry of the finger table and of the successors list

        Stabilizes one entry of the finger table

      • setLastSuccessor

        public void setLastSuccessor​(Node firstSuccessor,
                             Node lastSuccessor)
        Verifies if the immediate successor is consistent and replaces the last element in the successor list (in case the successor leaves)
        Parameters:
        firstSuccessor - immediate successor
        lastSuccessor - the new last successor
